actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

official_title: A bill to establish a training facility to support functions and activities relating to the licensing of commercial space launch and reentry activities, and for other purposes.
short_title: Licensing Innovations and Future Technologies in Space Act
subjects: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

summary.text:
Licensing Innovations and Future Technologies in Space Act or the LIFTS Act

This bill directs the Department of Transportation to establish a facility at which federal employees may receive training on functions and activities related to the licensing of commercial space launch and reentry activities.

The training facility shall be located at a current center of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) that, among other things

 has expertise related to the design and testing of space propulsion systems; is capable of conducting a wide range of testing capabilities, including large thrust-level atmospheric and altitude engines and engine systems test capabilities; and has a commercial space industry presence.

titles.title: Licensing Innovations and Future Technologies in Space Act
A bill to establish a training facility to support functions and activities relating to the licensing of commercial space launch and reentry activities, and for other purposes.
